relation: Project AeroGear will be developing and integrating new mobile, native, and HTML5 based frameworks that solve the hard issues that enterprise developers care about - such as offline data synchronization, security, JBoss AS7 integration, and support across a broad range of devices. More info at http://www.jboss.org/aerogear/WhatisAeroGear.html
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {40584=If you are a student looking forward to participate the GSoC 2012 with the JBoss Community, feel free to browse the growing idea list below. Please don't hesitate to contact the mentor(s) indicated in the proposal for any related clarification., 11077=Summary of idea: Replacement of old graphing with a new GWT implementation. This can be done with the help of existing graphing libraries for GWT. The replacement does not need to be 1:1, but there is freedom to implement different representations. A nice extension would be to be able to define a formula that translates the graph on the fly or where multiple metrics could be combined via formula., 33959=Below is a list of the ideas that have been proposed for the GSoC 2012 program. The ideas are organized by category.}
textBeforeTable: AeroGear   You can find more information below about the participating projects.   Participating Projects   Notes:   Associated project(s): RHQ (see below for more information about RHQ)   Mentor(s): Heiko Rupp   Contact(s): Heiko Rupp   Skill level: Medium to High   Knowledge prerequisite: Python, Linux system administration, qpid   Summary of idea: Write a RHQ-agent in Python and make it interface with Matahari to pick up metrics that are provided by Matahari from Fedora or RHEL systems. The agent would talk to the RHQ server via the REST api and push metrics to RHQ etc. This agent will not implement the full functionality of the RHQ java agent.   Status: Proposed   Implement an RHQ agent in Python   Notes:   Associated project(s): RHQ (see below for more information
textAfterTable: TorqueBox   Topic Details Project Description Project TorqueBox is a new kind of Ruby application platform that integrates popular technologies such as Ruby on Rails, while extending the footprint of Ruby applications to include built-in support for services such as messaging, scheduling, and daemons. TorqueBox provides an all-in-one environment, built upon the latest, most powerful JBoss AS Java application server. Functionality such as clustering, load-balancing and high-availability is included right out-of-the-box. Project Website http://torquebox.org/ Project Logo Category Ruby Mentor Bob McWhirter Project IRC irc://irc.freenode.net/torquebox
